column4: I didn't follow: are there data on any of your partitions, you want to keep?
yes windows ut it had 66 gigs of free space left
so you deleted your windows partition?
no it's there i just use gparted to free up that remaining harddrive space and move it over to my linux side
ut according to genrich the partition has to be next to the ext to move and resize it
careful - in the screenshot you posted there is no windows partition at all
it's the top one it's called /dev/sda1 ext3 with a darker blue
i used gparted and those are the files it gives me besides that is the exact amount of harddrive space that my windows side used
i left 6 gigs for additional space and used 66 gigs for the transfer
if you look carefully you will see that the first ext 3 still sys it has 72.91 gigs of free space unused which is not true
it adds up the same because i used 66 and left 6 which is 72 gigs
I'm still dubious, but anyway: you should be able to resize the ext. part. , and *then* sda5, if thats what you want, but ...
i tried to do this in livecd and it only gave me the option with the unallocated space to make it a new file
I'm afraid, there is something wrong with your partition table, but right now I'm too tired to look it thoroughly over, maybe somebody else will have a look at it
alright thanks is there anyone else tat can help me
you will have to ask the channel again (no nick in the beginning), it might help if you restated your problem on *one* line - good luck
